metadata.title: CVE-2017-10708 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Apport through 2.20.x. In apport/report.py,Apport sets the ExecutablePath field and it then uses the path to runpackage specific hooks without protecting against path traversal. Thisallows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted .crashfile.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-10708` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apport - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.10
apport-gtk - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.10
apport-kde - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.10
apport-noui - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.10
apport-retrace - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.10
apport-valgrind - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.10
dh-apport - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.10
python-apport - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.10
python-problem-report - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.10
python3-apport - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.10
python3-problem-report - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apport package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.20.1-0ubuntu2.10').
